channel.title: RSCOCC - Object Code Creator
channel.description:
Once again here I am with another release of a generator :palm: well see, I lost the old generator I created, which was actually becoming a pretty fancy program.
I created one today to help myself along through my project and figured i'd release it since all of my old software links are dead.
[b]Old software I created previously:[/b] https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,598558.msg4209329.html#msg4209329 and https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,597037.0.html
[b]THE NEW SOFTWARE:[/b]
[img]http://i66.tinypic.com/rqvfyt.png[/img]
DOWNLOAD LINK: http://uppit.com/ehe7287sch4z/RSCOCC.zip
[b]WHAT IS THIS FOR?:[/b]
Well it saves you a lot of copying and pasting, instead just fill in the form and press add keep it next to your client as you walk around in-game to get your coords, etc...
This is great for tree's.... click in a spot and change the coord then press add to list. Fill the list up as full as you want then finally, highlight the list and copy it using ctrl + c then paste it into your gameobjectloc file, of course underneath your current code don't make the mistake of replacing it.
After your done pasting it, and saving it make sure you clear your list using the clear list button. Otherwise you will have duplicate objects laying on top of each other, or the server won't start one of the two.
This is also great for people who want to take a project on together, you can give your partner this software and say alright go make a list for the new castle, fill it up with furniture and all of that good stuff.
Then he/she can copy and paste the list into a notepad file and send it on over to you, allowing you to easily insert what they've created into the game rather then having to pass your object file back and forth.
It's really a simple piece of software, that i've always found VERY useful you may not, but not everyone will care for a less-hassle object placing experience.
Take care, just wanted to update them old rsc server junkies :p

item.title: RSCOCC - Object Code Creator
item.dc:creator: @its2013 its2013
item.description:
@its2013 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:553919”]That honestly looks like it’d be about the same amount of work as copy/pasting an object and changing its values.
Why not make a GUI that loads the file, then allows you to manipulate all objects… Including adding new ones, or removing ones.[/quote]

It’s really a lot less work, because you only have to copy and paste 1 time, versus several.
You also don’t have to risk messing your format up, as this automatically inserts the format.

As I’ve stated though, some will find it useful some will not; don’t use it if you do not care to.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCOCC - Object Code Creator
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That honestly looks like it’d be about the same amount of work as copy/pasting an object and changing its values.
Why not make a GUI that loads the file, then allows you to manipulate all objects… Including adding new ones, or removing ones.

Read full topic
